text: Python thinks I'm passing more arguments than I am?
Trying to set up some basic socket code in Python (well, Jython, but I don't think that's relevant here).

code:
import socket
class Foo(object):
    def __init__(self):
        #some other init code here

        s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
        s.connect("localhost", 2057)
        s.send("Testing 1,2,3...")
        data = s.recv()
        s.close()
        print data

text: I get the feeling something really simple is staring me in the face, but I can't tell what I'm doing wrong.
